text: Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Aroma - well soured, soured bran borsch, troubled and soured white wine, pickled apples. Taste - very sourish, juice of picked cabbage, a bit of vinegar, young soured white wine, yeasts. Very good!
BOTTLE 37 CL. Almost clear golden, off-white head. Classic funk, oily seeds, slightly fruity. Similar taste. Not much I can see left from the barrel. A good standard Gueuze.
Bottle sample at SBWF. Pours yellow with almost no head. Both aroma and taste has a lot of herbs. I really enjoyed this beer!

Bottle sample at SBWF.
Pale no head.
Aroma of strong citrus and sourness. 
Taste bitter and sour.
Sample @ SBWF. Sweet, dry and vinous thing with notes of vanilla, hay and weed.

Light brown in color with orange shades. Haze. The nose acidity is gentle, well mixed with funny and interesting funk notes. The sourness in the mouth immediately gives way to more sweet notes, light sweet-sour notes coming from grapes. The great body, the nice carbonation and a near-perfect balance make it easy to drink. It leaves a complex and fresh mouth. Fantastic beer

7.7%ABV. Lambic,

Tapped out Amber. 10ºSRM.

Nose has acetic, lemon juice, white wine aromas.

Mouthfeel is juicy. Palate has some nice wheat malt flavors of wheat flour, raw dough. Other flavors for this one are a ton of white wine flavors and grappa like tannin finish. There is a brief fruitiness that evaporates into a dry, dusty, woody palate. Dry and very pleasing. Tartness is there but a lot less aggressive than some other lambics in the Spontan series, like the triple berry for example.

Overall mouthfeel and taste experience approaches that of nicely aged, dry boon.

Bottle (375ml) as "Spontansauternes" with BB of 15/1/23. Quite noticeably sour rivalling Cantillon with a barnyard lemony funky tart dry finish. Medium body, lively mouthfeel, hazy deep golden appearance, loose white head that settles to a stable collar. The brewer knows his stuff.
From tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Dark orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, sourness, tartness and grapefruit

(bottle) hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of vanilla icing and lemon juice, quite oxidized, with lots of flan base, some caramel and mouldy cheese. flavour is more vanilla, some mango cream and lemon juice, with a hint of digestives, kiwi and a rather tart finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

375ml bottle from 100 Beers. Slightly hazy light orange-amber with a small white head. Funky aroma, barnyard, Cantilloonz, some noble hops. Flavor is medium tart and quite funky, a lot like the -loons in a way, which is awesome. Medium-bodied, crisp, and biting. Very good.

Amber color with off-white head. Aroma has lambic funk and some brown sugar. Taste is tart but not really sour, there is some underlying malt sweetness. The specific lambic funk is present but not cloying at all. It feels overall like a younger lambic. Medium body and carbonation, not too dry. Really good, easy to drink lambic with nice yeast funk.
Bottle. Pours a clear light golden color. Aroma and taste is like lightly tart white wine.

Bottle at home, 28/12/15.
Clear golden orange with a well appointed off white covering. 
Nose is funky, wood must, touch of dry rot, lemon rind, pissy lemon, tarte white grape. 
Taste comprises tarte citric peel, straw, wood must, spice, white grapes, damp hay. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close with a tarte lemon wash and rising but restrained acidity. 
Decent xour.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle as Spontan sauternes. pours orange with a white head. Aroma of green grapes, goose berries, some sweeter vinous notes, weak butter and a bit of gueuze funk. Interesting. The taste is a bit like dry champagne but also have some grteen apples, white wine very sour and funk and with some darker fruity notes as well. Body is very oily which gives this beer another dimension. Nice indeed!

Bottle as SpontanSauternais. Pours clear dark orange with a medium white head. Aromas of dessert wine, vanilla, butterscotch, biscuits, green grapes, green apples, gooseberries, oak. Taste has a lot of green tart apples, grapes, gooseberries, sweet butterscotch, vanilla, oak, "jura" white wine, light vinegary. Damn, this is complex! By far the best beer from the spontan-series for me.

Rated as spontansauternais. Bottle. Pours a clear, golden amber with a big, short lasting, white head. Aroma has gooseberry, dry white wine, green apples, grapes, oily malt sweetness, funk, citrussy lemon tartness and vinegar. Taste is sour and dry up front, but quickly gets more smooth, slightly sweet with some vanilla notes, oaky and more sweet vinous fruity notes. Lime fruity tartness. Oily texture and a medium fizzy carbonation.

Bottle.Dark golden colour with medium white head.Aroma is sour of vinagar and sour tart fruits,yeast and acid flavor nice dry with hint of greaps and citrus,even nots of wood really nice overall beer.

37,5cl bottle from somewhere I cant remember. Maybe cerveteca Lisboa. Hazy dark gold. Thin white head. Taste is medium to high sour, medium sweet. Flavour is hops, wheat, grass, wood, fruit, barnyard, lemon, popcorn.

375ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours hazy orange with thin white head. Lovely sweet citric funk aroma. Taste presents a lovely sweet wine influence with luscious butterscotch on the finish. Wonderfully blended with a nice tart sourness. Awesome.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with almost no head. Aroma of grapes, funk, tart, vinegar, light acetone. Taste is quite tart, sour, not that complex, dry wood, light leather.

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop; hazy burnished amber pour with a thin beige head, aroma has a shit load of funk along with some citric action, taste involves tart grapes, some vinous action, lemon zest, some wood.

375ml bottle from Mikkeller webshop, as Spontansauternais 5.5%. Deep golden colour, white foam head and aroma of citric rind, honey, funk. Taste is tart, grain, some biscuit, lemon rind, grape, fruity, barnyard, tannic. Medium bodied, soft to medium carbonation, dry sour finish. Very drinkable.

(As Spontansauternes, 375ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Oct 1 2015) Pours a clear dark orange-gold with a large dense white head that lingers and leaves lots of lace. The aroma is very much like a proper gueuze, dominated up front by lots of wood, earthy forest floor Brett funk and medicinal herbs, overlaying a core that has sweet wine grape character from the barrels, pale pit fruits, and a slight lemony lactic note. On the palate it has a moderate level of sourness, the character of which is mixed lemon/yoghurt lactic and cider/white wine vinegar acetic. Acidity is balanced by a white grape and sweet wine core from the barrel, pears and under-ripe pale pit fruits. The finish is dry, very woody with a light earthy Brett funk. Moderate bodied with soft, effervescent carb. Its soft and rounded, perhaps verging on too round but the result is still elegant and very nice to drink. Matches quite good gueuzes from Belgium, and is the best of the Mikkeller takes on the style.
One of the best lambics Ive ever had , the Sauternes influence gives a subtle sweetness to the lambic sourness, brilliantly balanced. Mikkeller is producing some great sours in this spontan series.
Bottle. Golden hazy pour. Funky, lambic/gueze, funky leather aromas. Leather, sour, Brett, funk flavors. Cant believe this mikkeller, wow!
Funky farmhouse aroma in a golden pour. Taste is balanced combination of sweet, sour, fruit, and wood.

(Bottle, as SpontanSauternes) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, sour nose with grapefruit, green grapes, oak wood and barnyard. Fruity, tart taste with notes of citrus, grapefruit, sour green grapes, barnyard, hints of wood and a dry, tart finish with some harsh tannin flavours. Medium body, very dry. Fresh, tart and well made gueuze. Very nice.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours golden amber, fizzy, dry toffee, sweet, grapes, tart.

Bottle: 2012 vintage. Thanks, Kevin. Hazy, burnt golden & lightly amber body, lots of rising bubble steams. Soft, off-white head settles quickly to a lazy film & collar. Aroma has a huge waft of tannic oak, white wine, grape, lemon, musty earth, light herbal grass, & a touch of cotton funk. Quite tannic flavor, as expected. Sharp oak, white wine grapes, light barnyard funkiness, lemon, hints of under ripe stone fruit, & a hint of earthy, grassy bitterness towards the finish. Lingering with a heap of dry oak & old cotton blanket crittery funk. Extremely dry. As with the rest of the Spontan series that Ive had, pretty damn enjoyable. Nice stuff.

Backlog rating. 37.5cl bottle from BD Camden, London. It pours a light golden color with a medium white head. Aroma acidic and dry, with notes of white wine, wood, vinegar, lemon juice. Taste is winey, funky, with notes of hay, barnyard, lemon juice, grass, white grape skin, vinegar. Finishes tart and dry. Light bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, good

@ Stordirren 14-11-26: stor syrlig doft av vindruvor. Smaken något lenare med drag av vindruvor. Eftersmaken tycker jag har hint av vitpeppar. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!

Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, lots of white wine, honey, citrus and berries. Light sour flavour, citrus, grapes, lots of brett. Finish wood, citrus, white wine and honey.(From 37.5cL bottle @ Procrastinated SpontanGent Tasting. As SpontanSauternes 2012. Thanks for sharing, Erwin!!)

Bouteille de la capsule Nancy. Couleur jaune trouble, mousse qui disparait. Nez raisin blanc fermenté, aigre, note allumette brulée, barrique neuve. Typique gueuze, mais plus subtile. Gout fruité aigre, grappe de raisin, vineux blanc, vinaigre acidulé, vieux bois, mousse. Complexe a décrire, mais cest tout ce que jaime. Longue fin aigre, vinaigre acidulé, brulé. Très bonne lambic!!

Bottle 37.5 kindly shared by Calisky. A cloudy copper orange beer, nose is lambic like, tart, wet forest. Aroma is on astringent fruit with tart and floral notes, sour, hazelnut, leather, moist, wet forest, good complexity, not too dry. Finish is on lemon notes, tart, wet grass, light vinegar.

Bottle. Deep gold pour with thin ring of white foam. Aroma is nice, really dusty gueuze aromas, surprisingly close to the real thing, musty barnyard funk, light menthol. Taste is tart, mild funk, just a touch of acetic sourness. Palate is dry, med bodied with low carbonation. Surprising by its authenticity, and quite drinkable.
A standard Geuze with a fine apperance nothing to complain about but we did expekt more from mikkeller

Bottle shared at a Sour Tasting at Beer and Beyond shop 22-June 2014. Pours clear yellow with a medium head, aroma of fart, barnyard, horse blanket, brett, lemon, wood, flavor is sour with barnyard, lemon, vinegar, green tea, dry, intense carbonation, medium bodied, great
Rund säuerlicher Antrunk, rund, würzig. Bitter säuerlicher Mittelteil und Abgang. Trocken aber gelungen. 11/12/7/8/9/8

375 ml "Spontansauternes" bottle from czar, thanks buddy. Pours a very cloudy orangeish with a resilient white head. Aroma is very funky, very tart, white grapes, oldish, humid. Flavor is loads of white grapes, oldish, moisture and tart. Finish is very tart, some brett funk. Light to medium body, weak to average carbonation.

Looks.. Orange/amber, sml white head.
Smells..unripe green apples, lemons...acidic, barnyard.
Tastes.. All the fresh acidic green fruits/citrus sour notes are there, but then slightly dulled before they reach their peak, by the sweet white wine and oak woodyness, lingering sweet white booze, very classy.

375 ml bottle

Picked up last summer in Belgium I was finally able to share this great release with some other people in July. A fantastic gueuze has a different style than the Belgian versions yet still sparkles with a world class sourness. If these were not so expensive might buy them more often.

Aroma / Appearance - A transparent golden base shimmers with lively carbonation for company. A thin wisp of head curls around the edges. Sharp vinegar, acidic aspects, and sherry are tart on the nose. This feels a little heavy though overall it works well.

Flavor / Palate - Vinegar, sherry, and lactic acid are abrasive and refreshing at the same time. A sharp cheesy note carries to the vinegary finish. Like a champagne glass topped off by a splash of bourbon the sweetness, acidity, and texture are ideal. It would not be hard to drink a whole bottle in one sitting.

Doré, pâle et trouble, une mousse mince mais persistante apparaît lors du versement. Le côté funky de la bière est difficile à ignorer lorsquon y plonge le nez : cuir et écurie sont en vedettes. Des raisins blancs sont également de la partie, autant au nez quen bouche. Ainsi, on a limpression de boire un bon vin blanc ou un délicieux champagne tellement lacidité est prenante. Celle-ci contribue à activer le processus de soif de façon perpétuelle. Dommage que la bouteille soit si petite.
Bottle at Spuyten Duyvil. Clear pale yellow pour with a white head. Mild lemon bouquet. Lemon, barnyard funk, and citrusy hop notes. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle bought @ The Mikkeller Webshop. Labeled Spontansauternes 2012. Pours hazy pale golden with a rather big frothy and fizzy goldenish white head that quickly dissipates while leaving some spotty trace on the glass. Smell is sour and funky with crackers, green apples, grapefruit juice, moist wood, barnyard, hay, dry soil, white grapes, leather, horse blanket, red currants, gooseberries and hints of white raisins. Taste is sour, slightly salty, slightly bitter and slightly funky with sourdough crackers, grapefruit juice, white raisins, moist wood, Chardonnay wine, hay, dry soil, leather, barnyard, unripe currants, apple skins and hints of horse blanket and grape juice. Mouthfeel is crisp, dry, tart, slightly mouth-puckering, slightly tannic astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is sour, tiny salty and slightly funky with sourdough crackers, saltines, grapefruit juice, moist wood, moist hay, dry soil, grape juice, leather, barnyard and horse blanket. Enjoyable and decently complexGiven some time this actually opens up a lot in the glass. Very tasty gueuze with subtle complexity both from the wood and from the noble rot grapes. Have to bump up the score a little...

Bottle shared at a Sour/Wild tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. As SpontanSauternes. 2012 bottle. Clear gold with a white head. Aroma of oak, funk, citrus and white-wine-fruitiness. Sourish oaky flavor with white wine, a light metallic yeasty touch, a sweetish note, funk and some lemon. Medium-bodied. Refreshing.

375 ml bottle to snifter (2012 vintage; shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a mostly transparent orange with foamy white head. Smells good too; funky and oaky with notes of horse blanket and lemon. Tastes like it smells, but not quite as funky. Pleasant on the palate with a nice, dry mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

16.06.2014, 0,375l bottle (as Spontansauternes) @ BBGTC tasting:
Tiny shortlasting head. Aroma is fresh and mild sour, sour socks, sorrel, oak, hay, horse blanket, rope, weeds. Taste is dry grassy, weeds, hay, oak, rope, heather, bark, sour socks. Medium bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Nice enough.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC feat. Yngwie and Meilby. Slightly hazy orange-golden body with a small white head. Nose is funky barnyard tones, stable funk, hay, citric peel, hints of lemon acid, white wine and grape notes. Taste is dry wooden tones, grape peel, mild lemon acid, barnyard funk and hints of citric peel, straw and hay. Light body, soft carbonation. Nice beer in the classic lambic tradition from Mikkeller.

Bottle 375ml as "Spontansauternes" @ ClubGonzo
Pours slightly hazy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, funk, barnyard, white wine and oak. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with a long dry sour and oak finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, 375ml. Its a lightly hazy golden beer with a small, white head. Lots of lambic on the nose, funky barnyard and leather, some apple and some horseblanket. Old saddle. Pleasant flavor with the funkyness dominating. Funk, barnyard and horseblanket. Lemon and a little vinous touch, woody hints. Medium to full body with a low but pleasant carbonation level. Lasting finish. Sure one of the best Mikkeller Spontan beers Ive had, if not the best. 140616

24/V/14 - 37.5cl bottle as "SpontanSauternes" from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ Procrastinated Spontan Gent Tasting - BB: 15/I/23 (2014-543) Thanks to Erwin for sharing the bottle!
Clear deep yellow beer, creamy small white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: pretty smelly, musty, aggressive, dust, lemon peel, chlorine. MF: lots of carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty bitter, lemony, sourish, lemon peel. Aftertaste: fruity touch, pretty bitter and dry, grape pits, lemon peel, puckering sourness, bit dirty.

375 ml bottle @home shared with the wife. Golden hazy pour with a frothy head that quickly fades. Nose has light funk, green apples, grapes and some light lemon. Taste has notes of lemon peel, green grapes, light funk and some earthy notes. Finishes dry with a tad of bitterness.

Pours hazy light orange with a medium white head. Aromas of funk, white wine, citrus, slight honey. Taste is white wine, funk, citrus, light peach notes, honey, kiwi. Mouthfeel is quite crisp and sprightly with medium carbonation. Aftertaste is white grapes, funk, citrus that lingers quitw awhile. Very good!

Pours cloudy yellow amber with tall white head. Aroma of green grapes, apple, bretta, fresh grass, elderflower. Taste is medium fruit tart with lightly sweet funky finish. Light crisp body with soft carbonation.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. 1012 green bottle poured into a tulip. Pours clear golden with big white head. Aroma is tart/yeasty, medium/light body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is tart and yeasty. Expected more.

Bottled (Spontansauterne). Pours clear and deep golden with an average, lacing, white head. Aroma of grass, yeast, barnyard, citrus and wood. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery texture and soft carb. An excellent Lambic.

Pale yellow. Slightly hazy. Smells like fecal mater and white grapes. Very grapey with a touch of cranberry. Taste is muscadine and very hearty cranberry. Solid earthy mud and oak. Quite sour. Has the most bitterness of all
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein orange-goldenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch säuerlich, Citrus, Trauben. Geschmack sauer nach Trauben, Citrus, hefig.

2012 Bottle, with 7461301 code on the cap, drunk 3/14/14As soon as I pop the cap, a huge oak and leather aroma pours forth. Wow, this is going to be a lot better than Spontanfrederiksdal...Looks like a lambic; bright golden body with plentiful carbonation and a medium white head that recedes fairly rapidly to cover. Perfectly clear.The strong oak and leather nose adds notes of band-aids and just a hint of burnt rubber a la Cantillon. Not too far off on many aspects of that one, with not quite the strength or purity of that one (touch of tin and rhubarb in this). Perfectly attenuated malt and no alcohol noted.Deliciously bretty in the flavor with more rubber, band aid and lime zest. Nicely carbonated with an effervescent but tight bubble and a supple wheat-like chewiness to the body. Some light bitterness up front seems to show light hoppiness but its consumed quickly by that tartness from the brett. No astringency or overdrying from the barrel and very light on any actual sauterne character. Like a 3F oude gueuze with a touch of Cantillon blended in. Or maybe just very similar to Cuvee des Champions? I dont know. Pretty frickin good either way. Damn, now I have to go buy more Spontan series beers...hoping frederiksdal was just a fluke.

12.7 ounce bottle, dated 2012 on label. Served in a tulip, the beer pours a hazy gold color with an inch and a half off-white head. The head lasts a little while, but there isnt much of any lacing at all. The brew smells like white grapes/wine, oak, funk, hay, and some apple. Taste is nice and tart, it tastes like oak, funk, white grapes/wine, hay, and some earthiness and vinegar. Mouthfeel/body is medium, with a moderate amount of carbonation. I like this beer overall, but its not one of my favorite gueuzes. $15.99 a bottle.

Des notes grasses et sucrés de vin Sauternes avec des brett très actifs qui sarrondissent avec le vieillissement en barriques. Le corps est un peu trop aérien pour mon goût, même avec du repos. Les saveurs sont superbe, vineux, abricot, marmelade, citron confit, amandes grillés, beurre de brett.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar SF, February 2014. The bottle cost 28 USD. 

Hazy golden/yellow with a small head. Aroma and taste of citrus, barnyard, funk, wood and hay. Not that tart. Not bad but neither the best one of the different "Spontan" beers that I have tried from Mikkeller.

Bottle 375ml. [ As Mikkeller Spontansauternes ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy, manure, herbs, grass, moderate to heavy yeasty, barnyard, leather, grape, wood. Flavour is moderate sweet and acidic with a long duration, barnyard, grape, manure, light wood. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20131230]

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting as Mikkeller Spontansauternes. Clear golden with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, grapes, wood and brett. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 050214

Bottle @ Christers. Pours light golden with a white head, lively bubbles. Aroma oflight sour with white grapes, wine, wood, barn, little dusty, Flavor is sour, grapes, white wine, wood, barnyeard, dusty, little vinegar. Medium body, lively carbonation, acidic finish. 050214

Bottle as 	"Mikkeller Spontansauternes 2012", 5.5%. Clear golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, barnyard, tart and wine. Flavour is malt, tart, barnyard, little wheat, fruit, little wine, medium dry and medium bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are leather, sour malt, straw, fruits and hops.

pours hazy bright yellow with a nice frothy and creamy white head, good retention and lacing. funky-plenty, lemon, pineapple, hint of tropical, wood, white grapes, coconut, cheese, touch of sweetness. bright to average carbonation, light body - oily, herbal-grassy-citrusy and astringent finish. excellent - world class - the best in this series so far.
Spontansauternes bottle of 375ml. Clear golden color with white head. Bretty and "dusty" aroma. Vinous and sour but also sweet fruity taste with bitter finish.

Pours a clear (and light) golden with a head that rushes for the exit and not leaving much lacing. Aroma is truly gueuze-grade: tart fruits, grass, funk. Not picking any Sauternes apart from the usual gueuze-like fruitiness. Taste is tart and vinous, really nice! Barnyard and funk levels are good. Flavors of white grapes. This would be really hard to tell this one from a "real" gueuze I think. Body is light, mouthfeel vinous. Really, really nice!

Half champagne-sized bottle, as SpontanSauternes, brought home from Kihoskh, København. Body is pale golden, bright and clear. Rapidly dying low white head. Delicious aroma. Yellow-fruity and crisp vinous, with a scent of flowers and a light funky sourness. Prickling carbonation, easy and crisp on the palate. Taste has an underlying sweetness, nicely balanced by fresh and light acidic fruit flavors. And again, some fine funky/cellary notes. This is the good stuff. Sauternes!
Cloudy yellow large white head. Ver nice totslly clean lambic aroma. Sourish falvor wood wine greay sourush flavor delicious blend of great lambic and wine

Gylden klar skum hvid tæt 
Stald eddike blomst høns gødning citrus
Bitter lidt sur moderat sød lidt 
Flad
@peter c

Gylden , Hvidt skum, træ, stald, frugtæble, sur , sød, let, tør, livlig , citron vanilje .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375mL bottle, pours a hay golden orange with a small white head. Aroma smells like an authentic gueuze, with barnyard funk, white grapes, and some tart notes. Flavour brings out a big wallop of that noble rot character, with tart white grapes, barnyard funk, and citrus zest. Very dry, funky, citrus, and vinous - very authentically gueuze-like. So much complexity and highly drinkable. Awesome gueuze.

Bottle (375 ml). As Spontansauternes. Clear straw/golden with a medium mostly lasting white head and little lacing. Aroma is of barnyard, leather, grapes, hay, wood and dust. Taste is also of leather, nice funk, grapes and wood. Medium body. Medium/good carbonation. Dry finish. Very good! Drinkable, complex, dry... a world class Gueuze. Im really impressed by Mikkeller Spontan series so far.

375 ml bottle as "Mikkeller Spontansauternes". BBE 15.01.2023.
Pours clear golden color with a large white head. Aroma is tangy with grapes, some citric fruits, subtle wooden notes, grass and goose berries, faint rowan berries also. Flavor is fruity and very tangy with grapes, yeast and goose berries are there also with some lemon and distant vanilla notes. Grape fruits come through on the long tangy aftertaste. Sour fruity palate, lingering dry grapey finish. Very nice and a positive surprise.
2355

375ml bottle at The Bayou 
Pours cloudy golden with a medium sized off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is mild barnyard, sawdust, grapes and citrus. Taste is mildly tart, dusty, lemon with a dry finish 
Very nice, easy drinking and tasty.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2013 375ml bottle drank rapidly and in its entirety, alone. Some things are far too good for Danish measures. No idea what Sauternes is so that falls squarely outside my frame of reference. Pours lager gold- burnished towards the bottom of the bottle- with an insistent tight white foam. Nose horse, funk, sharp lime and crab apple. All that beyond with cream cheese, cork and gentle lime of the enamel-friendly variety. Vanilla in the aftertaste; the bitterness of cheesy, rancid old hops left mouldering in the corner of a Flanders cellar for several years. Drinks creamy, sharp and mellow like 3F or Cantillon splashed with Lucozade and all the heartburn acidity (but not complexity) sucked out. Suits me. World class.

375ml bottle shared with jeevan. Pours like champagne! Clear yellow gold, with a big frothy head, very high carbonation. Aromas of cider and cider vinegar, slight funky cheesy note. Creamy texture, dry finish. Not picking up much sauternes though.

Bottle 37,5 cl, BBE 2023. Pours golden in color with a small whitish head. Sour 

rhubarby notes, light barnyard, some ripe garden apples in aroma. Sour rhubarby 

fruityness in taste mixed with some more softer notes of mashed slightly sweet 

apples. Dry mouthfeel. Tasty and refreshing. Longlasting sour fruity notes and funky barnyard in the 

end.

Bottle. Amber beer with an off-white head. Tart/sour aroma with earth, light barnyard and light fruitiness. Sour flavor with light acetic, earth, and light fruitiness. Medium bodied. Sourness and earth lingers with light acetic notes, light grape, and oak.

Thnx to ships 
Pours fuzzy yellow ,small white head . 
Smell is sweat . Dry , lambic 
Soft carbo . Funky sourness , white grapes . Good , burlt not rememorable

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2013 375 ml. bottle split with 3 people. Procured from De Hopduvel in Gent. Pours a hazy golden with little white head. Nose is chockfull of incredibly raw horseblanket, brutal, old rotting wine barrel, very raw, huge funk, hay, lemon, brutal & in incredible. Taste is slightly toned down but it is all still there. Lots of old rotting wine barrels, oddly some light sweet oriental spices & touch of sweet white grapes followed by more funk, hay, horseblanket. Pretty acidic with light vinegar, tart lemon, slightly tart white wine grapes, white betteries, touch bitter old barn & hay. Unlike the nose, the taste is a touch too simple but great never the less still. Easy to drink, good carbonation. Not as good & schokingly different from Spontanriesling which had a great sweet/sour thing going on unlike this one, this one is way more raw than that one. This is pretty nice & interesting stuff.
Vibrant golden, whitish bubbly head with Syrupy funk nose. Taught tart up front, tinselly white boozy sweetness and tight sour finish, well bit sickly carbonation.
bottle at home ... golden amber ... thin white head ... soft tart funky fruity nose ... tooo fizzy ... soft fruits ... light funk fruity ... little horse blankety

Nice. Found my new favourite sour. Bouquet of soft bready notes. Bubbly. Tastes like a young sparkling wine. Would say more so like a dry proseco. Sourness and sweetness balance each other out. Neither is prevalent over the other. Really good.

375 ml bottle as Mikkeller SpontanSauternes.
Pours a hazy bright golden colour with a white foamy head. Aroma of leather, vinegar, white grapes and some lemon. Flavour of sharp white grapes, mild sweetness, wood, sweet peach and green apples. Medium bodied, foamy and a bit thin mouthfeel and high carbonation. Finishes dry, slightly fruity and citrusy. Unfortunately too thin and lacks character.

Tasted on 10/1/13 from a capped 375mL bottle purchased at Louisville Beer Store. Pours clear deep, rusty bronze, with a thick, fizzy, off-white head that quickly recedes to a thin, bubbly collar of lace. The nose is dusty, dry, and tart lemon-like a lambic, with a lightly nutty hint, but lacking the depth of the best gueuze. The flavor is very similar to the nose in that it is very close to being a gueuze, but no where near sour or complex enough to be. It has the dusty dry character with a touch of lemon, but the depth and sourness fall short. The body is light with fizzy, nearly sparkling carbonation, and a medium tart finish that shows some nutty malt.

Bottle. Hazy golden orange with medium white head. Aroma is fresh and fizzy; barnyard, hay, citric, peach, floral and vague malt/grain notes. Taste is clean, tart, hay, floral, lemonade, acid, minerals, peach, wood, and spice,

Hazy yellowish color, moderate head, decent lace/retention. Aroma is funky with brett, barnyard action, light grape, citrus. Medium to light bodied, tart, refreshing. I could drink a lot of this if it wasnt $18 for a 375ml bottle.

Får ett glas och frågan vad jag tycker? Belgien känns uppenbart i doften. Inte cantillon, inte 3F... Hmm. Boon kanske? Tankarna far till mariage parfait. Tar en klunk och bestämmer mig snabbt för att det är en mariage parfait i glaset. Ganska fel men dock intressant gissat. Känner inget av sauternfatet, inte heller efter att jag får veta vad det är i glaset

Bottle @ Sur Smagning Mashup Beer Festival as "Mikkeller Spontansauternes ". Pours hazy golden with a diminishing white small head. Aroma is very mild with apricot, citrus, brett, raisin, dried fruit, honey, wood and earthy notes. Taste is light+ bitter, sweet and tangy. Body is medium, carbonation is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finish is short and very dry.

Mash-up. Yellow hazy. Small head. Intense vinory. Gentle and still complex. Taste of a ancient brew. Lovely. The Best in the tasting. For an exceptionel evening.

Bottle. Pours orange gold. Quick dissipating white head. Nose and taste of sawdust, tart lemon, hay, wild yeast, lightly toasted wood and mild acidic lemon/citrus. Some barnyard notes. Lighter medium body.

(Bottle - Spontansauternes 2012) Hazy golden with big white head. Complex aroma - vinegar, citrus, cardboard, banana, sawdust - pleasing in its complexity but not hugely appealing. Lovely palate, velvety. Taste has similarities to aroma - intriguing complexity but, as appropriate for the style, rather challenging. The main components of the taste are a pleasant sourness, citrusy rather than the vinegar of the aroma, but more complex, and a spicy peppery bitterness towards the finish. Theres some ester notes and even some hints of sweetness on the mid palate. Unusual, and very drinkable.

Bottle as Spontansauternes from Bacchanalia, Cambridge. It pours hazy golden orange with a medium, fluffy white head. The nose is barnyard, hay, citric, peach, apricot, floral, damp leaf, light mouldiness and cheese. The taste is clean, tart, hay, floral, sherbet, lemonade, mild acidity, minerals, white grape skin, sour apricot, peach, mouldy wood, lactic notes and spice, Medium body and fine, lively carbonation. Nice depth and complexity. Well balanced and rather tasty.

Bottle. Clear golden with a thin creamy white head. Big, beautiful, funky, wine barrel, wet grain, and earthy horse blanket aroma. Soft, thick, creamy and bright palate. Tastes of lemon, tart cherry, pear, sour grape, and earthy wheat with a sharp clean finish. Very well done.

(Spontansauternes). Hazy-golden body, large white head, spotty lacing. Funky, citric, oaky, and light cheese. As the beer opens up, the flavor profile shows an increased fruity white wine character from the sauternes barrel. Medium to light bodied, moderate carbonation, pleasant acidity.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Pours very clear golden with a persistent, frothy, white head. Aroma has plenty of funk, green grapes, oak, white wine, lemony and apple zesty. Medium to high carbonation, very dry and fairly creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has grapes, dry oakiness, light sugary, apples, cidery. Very dry finish. Nice.

Pours a fairly pale yellow-orange color. Its somewhat cloudy, though I imagine careful bottle handling and pouring could render a clear glass. Medium white head. Pretty good bubblage for a sour. It smells like a gueuze, maybe somewhat young or, at least, from young barrels, but this is as close to lambic country as any non-lambic that Ive tried. Its delicate and complex with layers of funk and gentle acidity. It has the lambic mineral character, sulfur and iron. Mushrooms, wet hay, grass, mild vinous vinegar. If you gave me this glass blind, Id probably guess Drie Fonteinen or Girardin, based on the aroma. Knowing what it is, Im getting a bit more oak than Id expect from a lambic, but that could be bias creeping in. Lots of fruit - apricots, berries, peaches, lemons, limes, persimmons. I could smell this beer all day, which sounds kinda weird, admittedly. The taste starts with gentle fruity sweetness and very mild grain. Acidity creeps up slowly and the beer dries out completely by the finish. More lactic than acetic, but its a lambic-y mix. The finish has a lot of oak. Nice tannic hit aftertaste. Lots of lemons, funk, grass, earth. Some wine sweetness, which takes away a touch from its lambic-ness, but again, Im left wondering if Id notice it blind. Its light on the palate with a medium pucker that sorta sneaks up on you. The tannic oakiness is a bit bracing. This is simply delicious. I wish that American breweries would take note and start pushing domestic sours in this direction. I imagine getting lambic flavors right is rather hard, but its worth the effort. We need more lower abv, lambic-style sours.

Bottle. Pours a hazy pale amber orange color with a white head. Has a fruity malty spicy woody funky aroma. Fruity malty sour bretty funky weak woody wine flavor. Has a fruity malty woody wine finish with funky hints.

375ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a white head. Very tart and acidic. There's some funk in both the aroma and taste that I kinda threw me off a bit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Stone Sour Fest 2013. Light golden pour with a white head. Aroma has some hints of sweet sauternes, but is otherwise on the dry side. A bit herbal, some oak, grass, and lemon candy. Decently funky. Theres an herbal character to the flavor. Grape, light sweetness, lemon, and green apple skin. Tart and dry finish.

Pours gold into a tulip. Bright white head with medium retention recedes to hug rim leaving spider lacing. Grape, oak and funk aromas. Crisp with sour funk and caramel upfront turning to tart grape before the lasting earthy bitter finish.

Pours a golden orange hue with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma is really fantastic -- like authentic gueuze with a touch of white wine. Heavy lemon pith, clementines, white grapes, lactic acid, straw. Flavor is a little incongruent as far as gueuziness is concerned. Vinous white grapes abound with a subdued sourness before wheat and yeast wash through. Finish is bitter and mineral with heaps of brett. Very nice overall.

4th May 2013As Spontansauternes. Light haze on this gold beer, little white head. Light dry palate. Light geueze sourness battles with the floral fruity sweetness. Finishes dry. A little left field but quite nice.

Aroma: Stable, acidity, strawberries, leather.Appearance: A foggy straw colored beer. A low white head with small lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting bread, grapes, vinegar, cheese and bitter peel.Palate: Medium high carbonation, a coarse texture. A small body with a very dry finish.Overall: Very strict. Brilliant.Note: Bottle 375 ml at a De Klomp tasting. (Vintage 2012) Reviewed 2013-06-15.

Sampled as Mikkeller Spontansauternes Small snowwhite head, fed by lively carbonated hazed orange beer. Superb nose, mix of lambic and - indeed - sweet white wine. Old socks, grain, hay, wild citrus. Citrus, lactic acid, Brett and other wild yeasts returning in the flavour. Sauternes seems to mellow everything, making it a true "malse" lambic. Lemony, fruity, acidity. Bone dry, going to dry-out effect; effervescent carbonation, fascinatingly refreshing. Oh wow. Now I am impressed. Better collaboration between Mikkeller and de Proef hard to imagine.

Bottle, 06/04/2013. Pours hazy gold, orange twinge, fluffy white head dies to a fizzy haze on the surface, watery lacing around the glass. Aroma is lovely, light bleu cheese, white wine and green apples, vanilla, moderate barnyard, hint of buttery lambic, wood. Taste is mildly fruity notes of grapes and apples with Sauternes, vinous notes, soft funk, earthy dry wooden finish. Medium light body, soft carbonation fills things out a bit. Really nice geuze, interesting treatment.

37.5 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is brett, white wine, citrus, oak, vanilla. Flavour is white wine, citrus, brett, and grapes  with a very dry finish.

31-MAY-2013, bottle @home, from Ølbutikken.
Almost clear golden with lasting white head.
Aroma is brett, green apples, lime, lemon peel. Taste the same with a more woody note and a touch of sauternes.
Medium body and carbonation. A fine gueuze.

Bottle @ The Sleepy Ken Tasting, CPH. As Spontan Sauternes. The pours deep gold with a small head. The aromas lemon peel, grape musty. Earthy rotting fruits. A bit of brett. Sweet golden syrup. The taste is tart green apple. Sweet syrupy peach juice. Nice soft fruity finish. Medium body, smooth. Overall, quite a fruity lambic.

Bottle from The Trappist. Pours cloudy golden with a foamy white head and a sharp sour fruit aroma. There is an intense fruity flavor that is quite sour and reflective of the wild yeast resident to the Lambic region of Belgium. Nicely done.
Pours dishwater old with a slight, transient white had. Aroma is earthy and tart. Med body. Flavor is more gueuze  than anything. Earthy, sour. Finishes that way. Excellent.

Bottle at the super drunk Imperial tasting - Copenhagen. I cannot feel my hands! Pours clear yellow with a fine, white foam head. Funky lemon nose. Big sweet flavor, some grassy hops. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Grassy finish, par for a lambic. Great stuff.

Bottle at Mikkeller & RBJG#2 Grand Tasting. Clear golden - white head. 
Sulfor. Barnyard. Hugh dryness. Light malty notes. Sweet honey notes. Zesty. Grapes. Wooden dryness. Bitter zesty lemon finish. Lovely.

I am in a farmhouse wringing the liquid from the  the blanket the horse slept on last night, which was once  to be spayed in a dry white wine after the owner got drunk and spilled his sauternes. Not as sweet as I was expecting, but actually better than the Blaeber we had later.
Bottle at Tims RPJG#2. Pours a hazy yellow with a small white head. Sweet and sour with aromas of grapes and grapefruit. Also some dryness. Light to medium bodied. High carbonation.

Bottle at yespr.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of white wine and barnyard.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of oak and white wine with notes of barnyard.
Tart finish.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2014 375ml bottle - courtesy of BelgBeerGeek - thx! Pours stray yellow with a light light superfine head. My honest opinion? The base is lambic, for sure - Girardin? Lightly sweet aroma, funk and tart, light body and tartness all over the place... This is not spontanlambic as I knew it before... this is sooooo much better!
RBJG2. Aroma is fruity, rubbery, gooseberry, lots of funk. Taste is lovely, sour cream, fruity, tart, really good. Belgian, crisp and lovely.

Bottled. Light golden coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. aroma. Wood, sauternes, sourness, citrus, light barn and tart. Flavour: sourness, grape, fruits, light wood, some sauternes. Medium to full bodied. Ends very sour and grapy.

Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of brettanomyces, malt, spices, and grapes. The flavor is sweet with notes of grapes, malt, brettanomyces, and lemons, leading to a dry finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.
37.5 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruity, peachy and bretty. Bretty, citrusy and peachy. Tart, citric and fruity. Wineous and lingering fruity. Dry finish.
Bottle at RBJG 2 Grand Tasting, thanks Theis. Hazy golden colour with a small white head. Some quickly vanishing lacing. Sour yeast aroma. Sour citric flavour.
Bottle at RBJG courtesy of Theis, thank you sir!  Cloudy yellow color, fluffy white head. Aroma of wet leather, dusty lemons. Taste is funky white pepper and citrus.
Aroma of a fart, sulphur, leather, lemon, a bit of Sauternes hiding underneath. Very dry falvor, lemon, sulfur. Austere and mineral, with a hint of sweet grapes. Interesting.

38cl, Vintage 2012, as Mikkeller Spontansauternes, new exclusive Danish brew (aged on Ch. dYquem-barrels!), from De Hopduvel Gent, complex sour brew, woody/sour and slightly malty/vinous, very balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew, yet expensive!

I am #2. Yaaaaaa. Big thanks to Theis. Hazy golden color, light moderately frothy head. Cat piss, farm house funk, cobwebs, leather. Light, tart mouth tons of brett and funk, white wine. Rounded. Tart, leathery finish. Fantastic.

Bottle by Mikkel itself , thanks ! 
Head: small, white, foamy 
Colour: medium pale yellow 
Smell: malts, a bit sour, some creamy and fine aromas
Taste: start is somewhat sour with a champagne like dryness, followed by a natural malty sweetness, lots of fine fruity flavours not really any distinct fruit flavours, some creamy/smoothness probabbly from the barrels, a real fine beer !
